key_insight: eMOSAIC combines multimodal molecular and protein representations with per-sample, out-of-distribution-aware uncertainty estimates to produce more accurate and trustworthy binding affinity predictions across multiple targets (polypharmacology).
problem_solved: Affinity models often fail to generalize to new compounds or targets and lack calibrated, individual prediction uncertainty—making it hard to know which predictions to trust when prioritizing compounds for multi-target effects.
method: Multimodal encoding of compound and protein information to capture interaction-relevant features.
Per-sample OOD-aware uncertainty estimation that flags predictions likely to be unreliable on novel compound–target pairs.
Fusion of representations and uncertainty calibration to produce affinity scores with actionable confidence for polypharmacology prioritization.
impact: Provides AI/ML practitioners a practical approach to build affinity predictors that are both more accurate and better-calibrated for deployment—improving hit selection and reducing risk in drug discovery workflows. The framework is a useful template for OOD-aware multimodal prediction in other domains.
visual_elements: Pipeline diagram showing multimodal encoders (compound, protein) → fusion → affinity prediction + per-sample uncertainty output
Calibration plot: predicted uncertainty versus true error (showing improved calibration for eMOSAIC)
Scatter or density plot separating in-distribution vs out-of-distribution predictions with uncertainty color-coding
Case-study schematic: one compound connected to multiple protein targets with affinity scores and confidence badges to illustrate polypharmacology
paper_title: Multimodal out-of-distribution individual uncertainty quantification enhances binding affinity prediction for polypharmacology
paper_authors: Amitesh Badkul, Li Xie, Shuo Zhang, Lei Xie
